questions.correct_answer: B. 12 to 16 weeks of Intrauterine Life
questions.explanation:
Solution:

12 to 16 weeks of Intrauterine Life Fingerprinting- Study of fingerprints is known as Dactylography/Dermatoglyphics/Henry galton system/ Quetelet Rule Finger prints: First appears at – 12 to 16 weeks Intrauterine Life Completely forms- 24 to 28 weeks Intrauterine Life They are detected by Technique of Dactylography is superior to DNA fingerprinting. Fingerprints are different even in monozygotic twins and hence can accurately identify a person. Classification:

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,C and D. are incorrect.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to identify the vaginal cells on glans penis during the examination of accused of rape?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lugol’s Iodine Lugol’s Iodine test identifies glycogen in the vaginal cells which turns black on filter paper upon exposure to Lugol’s iodine vapour. It follows Locard’s principle of exchange. used to identify the vaginal cells on glans penis during the examination of accused of rape.

Highyeild:

There are two tests to identify presence of Vaginal cells on Penile shaft of accused: 1.Lugol’s Iodine test 2.Pap staining test Lugol’s iodine has been known in previous research that positive glycogen epithelial cells are a good indicator of recent sexual intercourse if they are found to be present on male glans penis , and has been used to identify glycogenated vaginal cells since they contain high content of glycogen than in all other epithelial cells and was accepted to be used as evidence in court. Lugol’s Iodine test identifies glycogen in the vaginal cells which turns black on filter paper upon exposure to Lugol’s iodine vapour. It follows Locard’s principle of exchange. However, it is important to note that it was later also discovered that the same is found in the male efferent urinary trac t, hence it was disclosed that Lugol’s iodine is not suitable to forensically determine vaginal epithelial cells on penis specimens following sexual intercourse. Nevertheless, buccal cells which are also found in saliva , it was discovered similarly that the cells reacted in the same way with similar morphological features as vaginal cells after using the Lugol’s iodine stain. In Pap staining test a smear is prepared from penile washing and observed under microscope for identification of vaginal cells.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Precipitin test - Used to identify the species- identifies the presence of proteins that are found only in human blood . Option B.Florence test and Barberios test is used for Seminal stain. Option D.Toluidine blue test - Examination of victim to detect recent micro injuries.

Extraedge:

Red stain: Luminal spray test (high sensitivity)- test of choice Spectroscopy (high specificity)- Most reliable test White stain: UV light Gold standard: presence of intact sperm under microscope (stain-christmas tree). Azoospermia-raised levels of Prostate specific antigen (P 30) + acid phosphatase.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Identify the mechanical injury shown in the picture?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hesitation Cuts Multiple, parallel, linear shallow cuts on the forearm mainly indicates Self Inflicted Injuries/Suicidal cuts.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Grazed abrasions -are caused by the dragging of the body against a rough surface , resulting in the scrapping of the epidermis. Option C.Sixpenny Bruises -These are the discoid shaped bruises of about a centimeter in diameter and resulted from fingertip pressure on victims neck. Option D.Patterned abrasions- are a result of perpendicular force on the epidermis, resulting in an impression of the offending item.

questions.text: Identify the poisonous plant having yellow flowers and seeds contained in prickly capsules ?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Argemone Mexicana Plant having yellow flowers and seeds contained in prickly capsules is Argemone Mexicana .

Highyeild:

Argemone Mexicana- Commonly known as Mexican Prickly poppy. The seeds of Argemone Mexicana resemble the seeds of Mustard seeds. These are used in adulteration of mustard oil. The seeds contain an active substance - Sanguinarine which causes Epidemic Dropsy. Symptoms are non-inflammatory,bilateral swelling of legs often associated with diarrhoea,dyspnoea, cardiac failure, may lead to death.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B.Nerium Odorum- is white oleander. Option C.Papaver Somniferum- is opium plant . Option D.Calotropis Procera- has star shaped flowers.

Extraedge:

Cardiac poison-

questions.text: In case of alleged murder of ‘A’ by ‘B’ at a certain place on a particular day and time, ‘C’ saw ‘B’ with a knife on that day at that place a few minutes before the murder. ‘C’ states this in the court of law. This type of evidence is _______________:
questions.correct_answer: B. Indirect Evidence or Circumstantial Evidence
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Indirect Evidence or Circumstantial Evidence This is a type of Oral Indirect Evidence or Circumstantial Evidence, as the Witness has not seen the crime directly , but has some information of around the same time and place.

Highyeild:

Evidence- Evidence is all those statements or documents which the court permits or required to be made by the witness on the matter which is under enquiry. Types of Evidences 2 types → Oral evidence Documentary evidence Oral Evidence: 3 types Direct Indirect or Circumstantial evidence Hearsay evidence Direct Evidence: Evidence of a person who has actually seen or actually heard or actually perceived by his own senses. Person ‘C’ saw person ‘A’ killed ‘B’. Indirect / Circumstantial Evidence: A Person ‘A’ is accused of killing ‘B’ by stabbing.Person ‘C’ has not seen person ‘A’ stabbing, but has seen the person moving or roaming around with a sharp weapon at the day and time of offence. Hearsay Evidence: Very little value Person ‘C’ says he heard person ‘D’ talking to Person ‘E’ that Person ‘A’ has killed ‘B’ . Documentary Evidence: 3 types Medical certificates Eg: Physical fitness certificate Sickness certificate, age certificate, disability certificate Medico Legal certificates Eg: Post-mortem reports injury certificate drunkenness certificate Dying Declaration

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Direct evidence : When the witness has witnessed the crime with his own eyes. Option C.Hearsay witness : when the witness has seen nothing correlating to the crime but has heard about the incident from another person . Option D.Hostile witness :is when the witness changes his statement in the court of law.

questions.text: All of the following are muscarinic manifestations of organophosphorus poisoning, except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mydriasis Organophosphate poisoning has mainly three types of manifestation in the body: Muscarinic manifestation which are generally diagnostic and are characterized by high glandular secretions , Nicotinic manifestation which are muscular manifestations and lastly direct CNS effect. Organophosphate poisoning causes miosis and not mydriasis.

Highyeild:

Organophosphorus compounds- Mechanism of action- They are very potent cholinesterase inhibitors They inhibit both true and pseudo cholinesterase. Signs and symptoms - a.Muscarinic symptoms- ( SLUDGE M) S- Salivation, glandular S ecretion increased L- lacrimation U –Urination D- Diarrhea G-GI distress E- Emesis M- Miosis/ pin point pupil b. Nicotinic manifestation (MATCH) M- Muscle weakness A-Areflexia T- Tachycardia C- Cramps H- Hypertension c. CNS manifestation Generalised weakness Ataxia Slurring of speech Tremors Confusion Headache Drowsiness Depression of Resp. centres Coma Death d.Chromodacryorrhea Shedding Red tears due to abnormal porphyrin metabolism and accumulation in the lacrimal gland. Diagnosis: Severity of poisoning % of cholinesterase Latent poisoning 10 – 50% Mild poisons 50 – 80% Moderate poisons 80 – 90% Severe Poisons > 90% True cholinesterase Pseudocholinesterase /plasma cholinesterase/ butyryl cholinesterase Present in RBC, grey matter of Brain, Skeletal muscle Found in plasma, white matter of brain, smooth muscle of GIT, viscera – liver, heart Is the most specific indicator of OP poisoning It is highly sensitive to OP compounds Activity <50% indicates poisoning Its levels fall rapidly. It is not specific, also decreased in liver, renal disorders Treatment- Specific Antidotes a. Atropine sulphate – Acts on muscarinic and CNS effects . No action on nicotine sites.It is given until all tracheobronchial secretions dry up and pulse rate should not be more than 140 beats/min. b. Cholinesterase reactivators Oximers – DAM - Diacetyl monoxime pralidoxime They specifically act on nicotinic sites. Always both of these used together, because they act synergistically. Post Mortem findings Kerosene smell of gastric contents.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B and D. are muscarinic side effects of Organophosphate poisoning. and Urinary Incontinence is due to paralysis of sphincter ( Nicotinic side effect).

Extraedge:

Carbamates: Treatment : Atropine is the specific antidote. Oximes are Contraindicated because oximes combine with carbamates to produce carbamylated oximes which are more potent cholinesterase inhibitors. Endrin: Same as Organophosphorus Also called plant penicillin Effective against different pests of plants Pyrethrin and pyrethroids: Toxicity is very low because of rapid metabolism Used as insect repellants Treatment : symptomatic – antihistaminic,adrenaline Both atropine and oximes are Contraindicated because they cause more harm than

questions.text: Most characteristic feature of muscarinic symptoms in Organophosphorus poisoning among the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Respiratory symptoms like salivation, rhinorrhea, bronchorrhea and bronchospasm

questions.correct_answer: A. Respiratory symptoms like salivation, rhinorrhea, bronchorrhea and bronchospasm
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Respiratory symptoms like salivation, rhinorrhea, bronchorrhea and bronchospasm are muscarinic manifestations of Organophosphorus poisoning.

Highyeild:

Organophosphorus compounds- Mechanism of action- They are very potent cholinesterase inhibitors They inhibit both true and pseudo cholinesterase. Signs and symptoms - a.Muscarinic symptoms- ( SLUDGE M) S- Salivation, glandular S ecretion increased L- lacrimation U –Urination D- Diarrhea G-GI distress E- Emesis M- Miosis/ pin point pupil b. Nicotinic manifestation (MATCH) M- Muscle weakness A-Areflexia T- Tachycardia C- Cramps H- Hypertension c. CNS manifestation Generalised weakness Ataxia Slurring of speech Tremors Confusion Headache Drowsiness Depression of Resp. centres Coma Death d.Chromodacryorrhea Shedding Red tears due to abnormal porphyrin metabolism and accumulation in the lacrimal gland. Diagnosis: Severity of poisoning % of cholinesterase Latent poisoning 10 – 50% Mild poisons 50 – 80% Moderate poisons 80 – 90% Severe Poisons > 90% True cholinesterase Pseudocholinesterase /plasma cholinesterase/ butyryl cholinesterase Present in RBC, grey matter of Brain, Skeletal muscle Found in plasma, white matter of brain, smooth muscle of GIT, viscera – liver, heart Is the most specific indicator of OP poisoning It is highly sensitive to OP compounds Activity <50% indicates poisoning Its levels fall rapidly. It is not specific, also decreased in liver, renal disorders Treatment- Specific Antidotes a.Atropine sulphate – Acts on muscarinic and CNS effects . No action on nicotine sites.It is given until all tracheobronchial secretions dry up and pulse rate should not be more than 140 beats/min. b. Cholinesterase reactivators Oximers – DAM - Diacetyl monoxime pralidoxime They specifically act on nicotinic sites. Always both of these used together, because they act synergistically. Post Mortem findings Kerosene smell of gastric contents.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B.Mydriasis is never present. Miosis is almost always present – Pinpoint pupils. Option C.Bradycardia is present . However during the acute phase Tachycardia with hypertension may be seen due to sympathetic ganglion stimulation but eventually turns into bradycardia as cholinergic effects take over. Option D. Skeletal muscle relaxation is a feature of Organophosphorus poisoning due to elevated Acetylcholine.

Table:

#MANTRA Pinpoint pupil-- Opium/Heroin Organophosphorus poisoning Morphine Pontine hemorrhage Pilocarpine

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of cocaine intoxication? Tingling and numbers of hands and feet Hypertension Hyperthermia Constricted Pupil and Bradycardia Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.correct_answer: A. A- True, B-True, C-True, D-False
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A- True, B-True, C-True, D-False Constricted pupil and bradycardia are features of organophosphate poisoning. All the other features are seen in Cocaine intoxication as explained below -

Highyeild:

COCAINE - Obtained from leaves of Erythroxylon Coca. Slang names : White lady, Coke, Cadillac, Snow Cigarettes with cocaine called crack Cocaine leaves contain < 2% of cocaine→ Treated with H2SO4 → Cocaine sulfate → Treated with HCl→ Cocaine Hydrochloride →Cocaine hydrochloride contains 90% of cocaine →Used for snorting and injections Cocaine hydrochloride again treated with baking soda → crack → smoke Most Common usage – snorting Actions Local Anesthetic Powerful CNS depressant – for a short time Rush followed by depression. Signs and symptoms Acute addiction: Stage of early stimulation- euphoria, dry mouth,tachycardia,numb mouth. Stage of advanced stimulation- hallucination, hyperthermia (cocaine fever), convulsions. Stage of depression- Muscle paralysis, coma, death. Treatment : Amyl Nitrate Chronic Addiction- Cocainism Cocainophagia Cocainomana Black discoloration of teeth & tongue Painless perforation of Nasal septum Magnum symptoms – also called cocaine bugs /formication/Tactile Hallucination → Bugs / Insects / Sand particles crawling beneath skin→ Scratching → Multiple scratch marks + →Bruxism → Grinding of teeth. Medico Legal Importance- Cocaine – 2nd most commonly used illicit drug. Applied on glans penis to increase duration of coitus. Prostitutes inject into vagina for local construction Cocaine + Heroine → I.V – speedball → smoke – moon rock

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B,C and D. are incorrect.

questions.text: Which of the following causes hypertension?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cocaine All Local Anaesthetics are Vasodilators except Cocaine, Levobupivacaine, Ropivacaine which are vasoconstrictors. Among these three, the most potent vasoconstrictor is Cocaine causing hypertension.

Highyeild:

COCAINE - Obtained from leaves of Erythroxylon Coca. Slang names : White lady, Coke, Cadillac, Snow Cigarettes with cocaine called crack Cocaine leaves contain < 2% of cocaine→ Treated with H2SO4 → Cocaine sulfate → Treated with HCl→ Cocaine Hydrochloride →Cocaine hydrochloride contains 90% of cocaine →Used for snorting and injections Cocaine hydrochloride again treated with baking soda → crack → smoke Most Common usage – snorting Actions Local Anesthetic Powerful CNS depressant – for a short time Rush followed by depression. Signs and symptoms Acute addiction: Stage of early stimulation- euphoria, dry mouth,tachycardia,numb mouth. Stage of advanced stimulation- hallucination, hyperthermia (cocaine fever), convulsions. Stage of depression- Muscle paralysis, coma, death. Treatment : Amyl Nitrate Chronic Addiction- Cocainism Cocainophagia Cocainomana Black discoloration of teeth & tongue Painless perforation of Nasal septum Magnum symptoms – also called cocaine bugs /formication/Tactile Hallucination → Bugs / Insects / Sand particles crawling beneath skin→ Scratching → Multiple scratch marks + →Bruxism → Grinding of teeth. Medico Legal Importance- Cocaine – 2nd most commonly used illicit drug. Applied on glans penis to increase duration of coitus. Prostitutes inject into vagina for local construction Cocaine + Heroine → I.V – speedball → smoke – moon rock

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B. Lidocaine-Most common and safest Local Anesthetic. can also be used in The only Local anaesthetic which can be given intravenously. Option C. Bupivacaine- Amide group , Most cardiotoxic Local Anesthetic . Bupivacaine exists as a Racemic mixture. Bupivacaine and levobupivacaine at lower doses appear to cause vasoconstriction, But cause vasodilatation at clinical doses . Option D. Prilocaine- It is associated with can also be used in hypertensive.

Table:

#MANTRA Poison causing hypotension Poison causing hypertension Opium Cocaine Organophosphorus Nicotine Carbon monoxide Amphetamine Cyanide Phencyclidine Sedatives
